dialogues.speaker: EXT HARLEM STREET
dialogues.text: A COLD WIND blows a bright red scarf tangled high on a st lamp. An iron waste bin is blown sideways into an intersection. stray dog investigates it briefly, urinates and then move A book bag drops onto the pavement. Visible from the waist down, a LARGE YOUNG WOMAN in a disintegrating leather jacket turns the waste bin upright then maneuvers it onto the sidewalk. Once finished, her thick hands wipe each other until they stop abruptly. Here, for the first time, we see her PLUMP, YOUTHFUL, VAC AFRICAN AMERICAN FACE. It is 16-YEAR-OLD PRECIOUS JONES. Something inside the bin has caught her attention. Precious gazes down upon a soiled and tattered paperback as the breath from her nostrils steams. The title of the staring back up at her is unintelligible. She pushes debris aside to get to it. The book plunges deeper into the trash, as if trying to f The sound of an ONCOMING CAR approaches. Precious pins the book against the bottom of the bin as t sounds of the oncoming car close in. Precious finally comes up with the book. Its title is sti unintelligible. When she flips it over, however, the lett on the cover, which are facing us now, make sense. They r CRYSTAL STAIR: SELECTED WORKS BY LANGSTON HUGHES.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The car sounds incredibly close. Precious looks sharply to her left. AN EERIE SKID precedes an eerier THUD! Precious, almost h falls back on to the pavement as her book skips across th intersection and down into a drain. She lays on the sidewalk pressed against the base of the street lamp with her eyes closed. The car reverses, skids, stops for a sec, shifts and SCREECHES off. The garbage bin, overturned yet again, rocks side to side until settling, to a stop. An ambulance eases up to the intersection. When the stoplight changes, the ambulance motors past Precious in no hurry. A moment later, its sirens BLARE an speeds off into the distance. The stray dog returns, re-investigates the garbage bin, a turns to Precious. He licks her face. Tom Cruise walks up her. Precious' still vacant eyes finally open to see Tom, and red scarf falling from the street lamp towards her. Tom g her a hand up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flirtatious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name girl? Precious blushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name? Precious still blushing, looks on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Precious Jones. I wanna take tap dance lessons. Mama said we can't afford it. A SCHOOL BELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The end of a final wave of students head to class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus she say who wanna see me dancing anyway. I goes to I.S. 111. In Harlem. New York. Today I was almost late. That'd a been a problem. Precious scurries behind them donning the red scarf and lugging her book bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious sits in the last row behind 26 children half her size, 3 years younger and mostly African American. Noise projectiles fill the air. MR. WICHER -A FRAIL MAN IN A BOW TIE AND TWEED COAT, stan at the head of the class trying to establish order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Class, would you please turn to page 122 ...Class! 122! Precious' book stays closed as the other students find th page. TWO BOYS in front of Precious giggle boisterously at some private joke. Mr. Wicher looks annoyed but accustomed to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like maff but I don't say nuffin' -don't open my book even. Just sit there. The giggling boys continue their shenanigans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys? The boys finally open their books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 122 please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyday I tell myself something gonna happen, like I'm gonna break through or somebody gonna break through to me -I'm gonna learn, catch up, be normal, sit in the front ...someday. The giggling flares up again. Precious sneers at the boys

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today we are going to review Monday's assignment. Would anyone like to begin? The boys get louder.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mr. Wicher looks at them helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys! ! !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like Mr. Wicher. I pretend he my husband and we live in Weschesser, whereever that is. I can see by his eyes Mr. Wicher like me too. I wish I could tell him all the pages in my book look the same to me, but I can't..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse you?! The entire class cries, "OOOOOH". Mr. Wicher looks scared

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody 'spect us to learn nuffin no way. Now I'm tryin' to have a motherfuckin' conversation back here if you don't mind Mr. Bitcher, I mean, Mr. Wicher. The boys fallout slapping hands. The class turns to Mr. Wicher in unison to see what he wi do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see you boys after class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Mr. Wicher but you ain't my type. Grow some tits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just be quiet. Mr. Wicher tries to carry on throughout the boys' unrelen defiance. Other students are continually distracted by th boys. Precious looks bothered the most as Mr. Wicher's so voice loses the battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feels sorry for Mr. Wicher. He do his best but he ain't got no voice. He scared too. I feels sorry for him. The boys break out in RIOTOUS LAUGHTER until ...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CRASH! A desk slams against the floor. The boys whirl aro to see two large hands take hold of them and snatch them of their chairs. Precious has had enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up motherfuckers, I'm trying to learn something! Hard enuff wiffout you stupid clowns carryin' on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trembling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...sorry Precious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trembling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cool. Precious shoves them down in their seats and huffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid asses... Go on 'bout cha lesson Mr. Wicher. They ain' gonna give you no more trouble today. Precious turns her desk upright and sits back down. Mr. Wicher looks grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm like the polices for Mr. Wicher. Tha's why I can't be late to maff. KNOCK KNOCK KNOCK. Someone is outside the classroom. Mr. Wicher waves her inside.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LICHENSTEIN, A SKINNY WOMAN IN HER THIRTIES WEARING
dialogues.text: DARK SKIRT SUIT enters, squints to find Precious, points briefly and then whispers something to Mr. Wicher. Precio rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now dis ... Mrs. Lichenstein sends Precious an oversized grin and bec to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claireece ...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Precious sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What this bitch want? Claireece ... Only motherfuckers I hate call me Claireece. Precious gathers her belongings. The other children watch every move in silence. When she reaches the front of the class ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna be okay Mr. Wicher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forcing a smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course Precious. Thank you. An unconvinced Precious grins sadly as Mrs. Lichenstein motions for Precious to step out ahead of her. Mr. Wicher looks abandoned. The door closing behind Preci might as well be to a prison cell block. Noise inside the classroom returns immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious heads off down the wide hallway in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious waits among plants, plaques, pictures and file cabinets while Mrs. Lichenstein sits across from her read from a file. Mrs. Lichenstein closes the file and sets it on the desk between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you pregnant? You're sixteen, still in junior high school and pregnant with your second child. Correct Claireece? Claireece are you pregnant again? Precious stares at the file without responding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any thoughts about your situation? Precious shrugs her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claireece?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Claireece, I'm talking to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claireece?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I in trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I in trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Then I don't want to miss no more of maff class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious starts to rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly) Sit down Claireece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious sits and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) You know what I think? I think we should have a parent-teacher conference - me, you and your mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My muver is busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well maybe I could arrange to come to your house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My muver wouldn't like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then Claireece, I'm afraid I'm going to have to suspend you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't fair. I ain' done nuffin! I doose my work. I ain' in no trouble. My grades is good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your attitude is one of total uncooperation and that won't help a thing...

dialogues.speaker: PRECIOUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now I heard everything. Nosy        I'm not the enemy her ass white bitch mad 'cause          h there's something going on at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: she can't come over my house.        ome that you would l I don't be coming to this           talk about, you shoul bitch's house in Weschesser.        free to do so here. I I'll be damned. I done heard        find that the added s everything. White bitch wanna       caring for your child visit. Then I thought about         affecting your concen Mr. Wicher all alone up             that would be helpful against the fools in his maff       know. class ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now according to our records, your mother also looks after the child. Is that correct?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kids on her pictures. Maybe she jealous. I still don't say nuffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you in contact with the father? (beat) Is he at all involved in your child's care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine! If that's the way you wanna play it, we can do this all day. The hand on Precious' lap makes a fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thas when I knew I'd never get back to maff class ...Lawd I hate this hoe. Precious lunges from her chair and reaches over the desk. Mrs. Lichenstein vaults backwards in terror and tumbles t the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious bursts out of Mrs. Lichenstein's office and walk the exit. Mrs. Lichenstein's distant voice still cries fo security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious heads down the hall without looking back. Mrs. Lichenstein's CRIES are still audible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A faucet runs. Precious stands over the sink washing dishes. A moment la a WOMAN'S VOICE speaks over the sound of a TELEVISION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get my cigarettes? Precious freezes. Her HEART BEATS loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (delicately)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Mama, I dropped some of my thangs on the way to school. A SCREECHING CAR echoes distantly.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: DRESS sits on the couch with her back turned to Precious. This woman looks as if she is one with the furniture.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A cigarette smolders between her fingers as she watches " PRICE IS RIGHT" on television. Precious, still waiting for the other shoe to drop, looks momentarily relieved and returns to the dishes until ...

dialogues.speaker: CRACKKKK
dialogues.text: A thick glass ashtray smashes into Precious' head. Precious falls and lands ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...onto a bed completely naked.

dialogues.speaker: CARL KENWOOD JONES, A LARGE AND NAKED MAN MUCH MORE THAN
dialogues.text: TWICE HER AGE falls on top of her and gyrates. Moments later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy? An enormous hand muzzles her. Precious lays there impassively as her vacant eyes fixate a long crack in the ceiling. As we drift towards the crack it seems to widen -to open another world where...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blinding flashbulbs pop everywhere. Precious walks the red carpet with Tom Cruise. They head toward the entrance of the theatre stopping occasionally sign autographs. Both sport matching sunglasses. The paparazzi is going wild. THUNDER RUMBLES. Precious removes her sunglasses and sear the sky. A LIGHTENING CRACK ROARS. Rain starts to fall as ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drops of water seep from the crack in the ceiling accompa by the sound of distant THUNDER and MASCULINE GRUNTS morp into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the top of her lungs)

dialogues.speaker: I SAID I'M HONGRY YOU FAT LITTLE
dialogues.text: PIGGY CUNT BITCH!!! Git your Jezebel ass up and git to dinner 'fore I give you something to cry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes closed with ashes and tears on her face, Precious la still on the floor. Her hands are still wet from the dish GOOOSH! 2 gallons of water splash down on her. Her eyes spring open. Mary stands over Precious with a large dripping pot in he hands. She drops it on the floor and returns to the couch watch another program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I ain' gon' say it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pots and pans sizzle on the stove. Precious, now wearing a dry T-shirt, tends to dinner meticulously until ... ANNNNT! The sharp sound of a BUZZER rings. Mary and Precious turn to the door in unison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them assholes to stop ringing my bell. Here is our first good look at Mary. She wares way too mu make up. Precious wipes her hands and heads for the door though Ma sits much closer to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one ever ring the bell but crack addicts. I hates crack addicts. Give the ghetto a bad name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious presses TALK on the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop ringing the goddam buzzer motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious heads back to the dishes until ... ANNNT! The buzzer again. Precious returns to the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop ringing the goddam buzzer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Press LISTEN stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious sighs and presses LISTEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Sondra Lichenstein for Claireece and Ms. Mary Johnston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious' face goes blank. Mary looks alarmed and mutes t television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who that Precious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White bitch from school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lichenstein stands by the buzzer bundled up. THUMPIN RAP MUSIC FROM A CAR passes behind her.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She bounces lightly to the beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord, where is crack addicts when you need 'em...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious and Mary still try to sort this out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What she want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask her stupid. Precious presses TALK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you want? Precious presses LISTEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to you about your education.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty-six that bitch. Precious looks unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young man exits the building smoking a cigarette. Mrs. Lichenstein puts her hands together, dramatically pleads a smoke and gets one. She puts it in her mouth and lights hers to his. Bouncing stay warm, she nods in gratitude as the man walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This bitch crazy. 'Sides, my muver don't want to get cut off welfare and that's what Mrs. Lichenstein comin' to visit result in. It's hard to believe a hoe dis retarded sposed to educate somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious presses TALK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Git outa here Mrs. Lichenstein 'fore I kick your ass.

dialogues.speaker: ANNNT
dialogues.text: Precious presses LISTEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claireece I am so sorry about today. I only want to help you. I ...Mr. Wicher says you're one of his best students and that you have an aptitude for math -or at least potential. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've called a Mrs. McKnight at Higher Education Alternative / Each One Teach One. It's an alternative school. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claireece, are you listening? Precious looks at her mother. Mary clearly finds this all bizarre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claireece, did you hear me? Precious presses TALK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Precious presses LISTEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've called Ms. McKnight at Each One Teach One. It's located on the nineteenth floor of the Hotel Theresa on 125th Street. That's not too far from here. Precious presses TALK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where that is. Precious releases the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious presses LISTEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone number is 555-0831. I told them about you. Call or drop in, nineteenth floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Claireece... If you go down tomorrow.... Look, they have just started their semester. You may be a day or 2 late... Give it a try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lichenstein bounds off into the night with her cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what an alternative school is but I feel I want to know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious leans against the refrigerator glowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My heart is all warm...Mr. Wicher say I'm a good student.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is silent movement behind Precious. Mary approaches quietly wielding a skillet. Mary swings for a head shot but Precious easily sidesteps blow. The refrigerator takes the hit and a new dent. Precious stares calmly at her mother. Mary almost looks ashamed. Still aglow, Precious grins absently at her mother and th leaves the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mary watches her go and then struts back to the televisio speaking to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: School can't help none. Go down welfare. Who she think she is?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think she cute now right? Shoulda kept her mouf shut. Uppity now cause he give her more childrens than he did me. Should've kept her damn mouf shut. Stupid little pig. Who she think she is? What I'm sposed to do for cig'rettes now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious, now dressed for bed and still beaming, pulls th covers to her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises into the sky. The shadow of a tree draws shorter as does that of an open gate.

dialogues.speaker: PRECIOUS' BEDROOM
dialogues.text: The clock on the night stand reads 8:29. We drift back to find Precious sitting on the side of her fully dressed with neon yellow leggings and her red scarf she stares at the clock. Various sheets of colored construction paper display Precious' handprints on the wall. Their sizes increase progressively and end beside a poster of Cyndi Lauper. When the clock reads 8:30, Precious stands, looks in a mirror, sees a pretty blond white girl and leaves the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious heads for the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going? DUNK, CLINK, CLONK, CLANK -Precious opens 4 locks with sw precision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear me talking to you?! Precious leaves slamming the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We track with Precious as she exits her building. RUBY, A

dialogues.speaker: DARK-SKINNED HEAVY-SET LITTLE GIRL WITH A "NATURAL" HAIRS
dialogues.text: WHO COULD EASILY PASS FOR A YOUNGER PRECIOUS, trails Precious. A naked blond armless Barbie doll dangles by it hair from Ruby's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious when we gon' play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without turning around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain' you s'posed to be in school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said we was gon' play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, thas jus exackly why we ain' gon' be playin'. I never said nuffin like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause you a mess. Look at ya' -no style, no friends, no mama, no daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?! I ain' the only one. Precious stops abruptly and turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you say?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...nuffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thas what I thought. Precious heads away into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I check in wif you tomorrow Precious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious walks gazing upward. Street lamps pass beneath the sky as autumn leaves fall f nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm lookin' up. Lookin' out for a piano to fall, a desk, couch, TV, Mama maybe? Always somethin' in the way. Alternative. I'm gon' see all about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch where you goin' Orca! Precious looks down to find three skinny boys, each much smaller than she, taunting her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then my mind come back down to Earf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up fool, she gon' eat you. The boys burst out in laughter slapping hands and grabbin their crotches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyz always been little things that laff and grab they selves -cept for when I's real big and pregnant wif my first baby. Then boyz don't say nuffin. They stand out the way real quiet like I'm Queen of England... Pointing at her leggings, the boys erupt some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still, I wonder...what could I wear that boyz don't laff? Precious crashes to the ground. The boys look surprised a moment and then howl harder than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always be fallin like that when my mind be wanderin. Mama say I gonna fall to my death one day. Wonder what that be like?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The boys continue to taunt her from above. Precious stare into space as if they aren't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious in Black leotards, fishnet stockings and patent leather shoes tap dancing away. She finishes her number a Tom Cruise walks into frame clapping. Tom gives her a hug a friendly lick on the ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious continues to stare into space as a dog licks on ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious walks amongst a crowd of people and stops to sta at the Hotel Theresa, a beautiful pre-war building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious enters the lobby. An older black man in a blue uniform sits in a chair reading the Daily News through th glasses. He doesn't move, react, speak to or look at Precious as s passes him. Precious glances back at him as she reaches the elevators presses the button and waits. The elevator doors open. Precious steps inside and turns around. Her eyes widen and time slows down. The sound of rises. Moments later, Precious snaps out of her daze and hastily pushes button 19. The doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious rises....5....8....14....15....and.... DING! 19. The elevator doors fly open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious steps out to find an AFRICAN AMERICAN WOMAN IN H EARLY 30'S WEARING HER HAIR IN "CORNROWS". She sits behind a desk while speaking on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you say that shit when you don't mean it Trey? I'm not playing with you and I know that wasn't your damn sister neither....because you don't have one...Fine. Yeah, whatever. Cornrows slams the phone down, mumbles and looks over a f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This the alternative?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This the alternative?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what is this here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Higher Education Alternative / Each One Teach One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for alternative school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an alternative school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What alternative is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you asking me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alternative. The lady from my other school tell me to come here to Hotel Theresa, nineteenth floor, it's "alternative" school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each One Teach One is an alternative school and an alternative school is like a choice, a different way to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need your discharge papers from your old school saying they have formally discharged you or we can't allow you in the program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got kicked out 'cause I was pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still need formal discharge papers or we can't let you in. It's the law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lichenstein ain' say all that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you're the one Mrs. Lichenstein called about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What she say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (searching papers) Are you Claireece P. Jones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thas me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well the principal at I.S. 111 already sent your discharge papers and stuff over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your academic record. Suddenly, Precious looks very concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right? Precious looks both angry and disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought this was new start. File and tesses chase me to the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claireece?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had to have certain information before we could accept you into the program. So really, their sending your records over was just a way of speeding things up for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I start today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. The only other thing we need right now is income verification. Are you currently receiving AFDC?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...My muver get AFDC for me and my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you've had amniocentesis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said your mother has custody of you and your daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this baby! I got another one 'sides this coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I see. Your mother has custody of you and your daughter so you're on her budget. Precious nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well I need a copy of your mother's budget and a current phone or utilities bill, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got to go get all that now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, relax. We're just gonna give you a few tests -test your reading and math level, see where to place you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the difference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, to enter G.E.D. classes a student should be able to read on an eighth-grade level. They should score 8.0 or better on the TABE reading test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in ninfe grade at I.S. Ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you should have no problem. Precious doesn't look as convinced.

dialogues.speaker: ECU
dialogues.text: Precious neatly writes CLAIREECE P. JONES on the top of t page.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Precious sits alone behind a smattering of empty desks in bright classroom. She looks over her test, exhales and starts to write.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TICKING CLOCK accompanies ... ...misspelled words ...eraser shreds ...tapping feet ...sweat ...giant letters ...tapping thumb ...tapping pencil ...frowns ...giant numbers ...eraser shreds ...sighs

dialogues.speaker: BZZZPFFT
dialogues.text: Precious looks up sharply. A square fluorescent light in the ceiling blinks and buzz as if struggling to stay alive. We tilt down from the blinking light to find that we are different place ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNGER PRECIOUS with uncombed hair sits with her back us in a bright pink dress. She is at the very back of the classroom.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The many children seated in front of her are all blurs th gradually fade into darkness while raising their hands. As we drift towards young Precious, the stains on her dre become more apparent. As we continue drifting, the PLAYGROUND VOICES OF OTHER Y CHILDREN ECHO out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What that on your dress Precious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She don't say nuffin'. She don't talk to nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the last time yo head was combed? Precious mumbles something to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What?! Shut up Precious. You talk funny. You was better when you was on mute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here come the wide load... Boys makes a lengthy FARTING sound triggering a CHORUS OF LAUGHTER. Our drift finally lands on a puddle of urine at her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teacher! Teacher! Precious peeded herself again! GIGGLES fill the air. A small pencil falls into the puddl making a large ripple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious' pencil point has broken but she still holds the pencil as if about to write.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Precious sits with an absent look on her face and a bead sweat on her temple. A moment later, a shadow moves over test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claireece, do you need another pencil? The administrator stands over Precious waiting for an ans

dialogues.text: Claireece ... Precious looks up to her blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you finished? Precious nods absently. The administrator gently takes the test from Precious' de and leaves. Precious lingers pensively in the back of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There has always been something wrong wif the tesses ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious walks with her hands in her pockets watching the pavement pass beneath her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The tesses paint a picture of me wif no brain. The tesses paint a picture of me 'an my muver -my whole family as less than dumb just ugly black grease to be wiped away, punished, caged up, kilt, changed, finded a job for. Precious leaves us behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I wish I was not alive. I be O.K. I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...A hand shuts off a shower . ...A toothbrush lands in a mug .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...A hairbrush lands on a dresser. ...Thick hands remove a red scarf from a drawer. ...The clock on the night stand reads 8:29. Precious sits on the side of her bed fully dressed with r leggings and her red scarf staring at the clock with a notebook in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today is first day. I been tessed. I been incomed eligible. I got my medicaid card, proof of address, self, pencil, notebook -alla dat shit.

dialogues.text: When the clock reads 8:30, she stands, turns to a mirror, sees a pretty blond white girl and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Precious stares into the refrigerator. ...Precious stares into the freezer. Finally, she closes the door.

dialogues.text: MA! !!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MA! !!

dialogues.text: I need some money.

dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sumthin' to eat. My head hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) How much you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Come and git it then.

dialogues.text: The air changes. Time stands still. A look that is both childlike and gray comes over Preciou face.

dialogues.text: Large panties fall to the floor from beneath the sheets. Mary's knees widen beneath the covers.

dialogues.text: A frozen Precious stares across the apartment for a brief eternity. Finally, she dashes for the front door, throws open the l and bolts out of the apartment slamming the door behind h

dialogues.text: Where you going?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious walks briskly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other day I cried, felt stupid. Guess what...Fuck that other day. Thas why God or whoever make new days. Still hungry tho.

dialogues.text: Precious stops and looks up at something. Before her stands a fast food restaurant with a giant sig atop it that says KICKIN FRIED CHICKEN. Precious looks around, takes a deep breath and steps insi

dialogues.text: What you want baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a basket please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sides? Precious' eyes wander from the fry bin all the way over t refrigerator towards the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't sure. still thinkin'. Watchin' the weight you know. The woman chuckles and then leaves for the chicken. The digital clock on the wall reads 8:53. Precious whirls around to see A YOUNG MAN CIGARETTE IN HI MOUTH spraying the door with glass cleaner and then wipin from the bottom up. Precious turns back around to find her server selecting pieces of chicken from a huge tray with large silver tong The clock on the wall reads 8:54. Precious turns to the door again to find the young man st cleaning it. Precious turns back around to see her server returning wi basket of chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Potato salad! Thas it. The woman nods, sets the chicken on the counter and heads back towards the refrigerator in one fluid motion.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The young man wipes the top of the front door and looks t about finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious bursts out of the restaurant with the bucket und one arm and sprints off down the block. A SCREAM from inside follows.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: A second later, Reggie, the young man who cleaned the gla dashes out after Precious. Precious looks back while sprinting and scarfing down pie of chicken at a remarkable rate. Across the street, SHEILA, Reggie's pregnant girlfriend, screams at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie, where you been? I've been paging your tired ass all night. Reggie stops dead in his tracks. Shit! Busted. He lights cigarette, about faces and prepares for her rant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nigga, I knew that was you. And who you running after, some fat bitch. Get your ass over here. Precious turns the corner of 126th street and onto Clayto Powell Jr. Boulevard still devouring chicken. A SKINNY DISHEVELED MAN sitting on a standpipe calls out her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gon catch indigestion Mommie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious finishes off the chicken at the exact moment she reaches the Hotel, stuffs the bones and basket into a tra bin and dashes into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious looks at her watch and then freezes as if someth terrible has just dawned on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious' notebook and pencil sit on the table where she them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious looks crestfallen. A glance at her watch makes i worse.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED

dialogues.text: The elevator doors open. Cornrows speaks on the phone whi picking her nails. Several lines are ringing. She waves f behind her desk as Precious walks by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What else would get away with clouding your mind, messin your heart and leaving the goddamn toilet seat up? Wait a minute girl.... She decides to grab a line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious, nauseous, makes her way down the hallway.

dialogues.text: Precious lunges for a trash bin into which she promptly vomits. She quickly catches her breath. Wipes her mouth and looks feet away at a brightness coming from an open doorway. He HEART BEATS loudly. Precious stands up. She seems to be there for a considera spell. A blur of a young girl darts into the room from the other of the hall without looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: MS. RAIN, PETITE, AFRICAN AMERICAN, BEAUTIFUL, THIRTIES,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time's a wastin'.

dialogues.speaker: B49 CONTINUED

dialogues.text: LEAN, SEATED AND DRESSED LIKE A BOY and CONSUELO MONTENEG LATIN DESCENT, PETITE GLOWING AND GORGEOUS. She twirls he hair incessantly with slender painted fingertips. A seventh desk sits well apart from the others back benea the windows. The girls all stare up at Precious blankly as she enters room. Precious looks to be in a mild state of shock as sh gazes around from the girls to Ms. Rain to the clouds out the windows.

dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does it make you feel? Precious looks around but seems to be searching inside mo than anywhere else. After a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Here. It make me feel ...here. The class is quietly taken aback. Precious smiles as if having just made it ashore from a s lost at sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious walks off alone still beaming from the new world has discovered.      P

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before, I got A minus in English and never say nuffin', never do nuffin'. But Miz Rain say we gonna read and write in our notebooks every day. Thas sumthin' seeing how we can't really do none of those things and then I think maybe this ain' tha class for me. But when Miz Rain see the worry on my face, she look at me and start to talk in Chinese... The ghostly image of Ms. Rain appears on the sidewalk ahe of Precious. It is a glimpse from back in the classroom. voice ECHOES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The longest journey begins with a single step...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain vanishes and Precious shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Whatever the fuck that spozed to mean. This school different, okay. But this not Star Trek neitha'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious continues into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Complicated, complicated -Chinese journeys, 2 books, write 'n you don't know how? Dawg ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain writes the letter A on the board and then hands chalk to Jermaine. Jermaine writes B and then hands it to Consuelo. Consuelo writes C and hands it to Rhonda. Rhond writes D and hands it to Rita. Rita takes a step and starts to cry. She drops the chalk. shatters on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all in this together Rita. Class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita picks up the largest shard of chalk from the floor a writes E on the board. She hands the chalk to Precious an Precious writes F. The entire class sits simultaneously and then giggles at their synchronicity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is just the beginning. Why don't we try by ourselves? There are 26 letters in the alphabet. They all have a sound. These letters make up all the words in our language. Please open your notebooks, write the date and then let's write the alphabet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls begin to write.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Precious soon sets her pencil down, moves her hands to he stomach and looks faint. She gathers herself, catches her breath and trudges on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is going to be painless ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious and Ms. Rain sit close together over a small tab looking down at a large colorful children's book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I just want you to read a page from this book. Precious looks up at her blankly and then back down at th book with trepidation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure lady, right after I get voted president.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that Miz Rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Precious. Give it a try. Precious looks mortified and starts breathing heavily.

dialogues.speaker: MEAT SIZZLING, ZIPPERS, GRUNTS, SQUEAKING BED SPRINGS,
dialogues.text: LAUGHTER, SCREAMS, A RAZOR SLICING YOUNG FLESH, SWEAT and DAYTIME TELEVISION all assault her mind's senses. Ms. Rain speaks with a dire look of concern on her face b no words come out. She places a hand on Precious' shoulder and the kaleidosc of sounds sucks away into the air. The words from Ms. Rai mouth finally register.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious. Honey are you okay? Try to relax. Should I call an ambulance? 911? Your moth ...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain jumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pages ... Ms. Rain looks down perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defeated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look alike to me. Always did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words or the pictures?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words. Ms. Rain sighs. She sits back for a moment and looks as i she's processing more than just the tragedy of this particular situation but what is that of countless others In a decisive, almost militaristic movement, Ms. Rain sit again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I understand you Precious but I still want you to try. You're going to have to push yourself. Precious looks back down at the page. There are people of various colors on a beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think the story is about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peoples at the beach?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Ms. Rain points to the letter A. It is the first word on page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. A. Ms. Rain points to the next word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know that word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know the letters. Precious nods. Ms. Rain points to the letters ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know that word? Precious shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day. That word is day. Ms. Rain points to the next word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good! Almost! The word is 'at'. Ms. Rain points at the next word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The! Ms. Rain points to the next word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Beach?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Shore'. That   word is 'shore'. That's almost   like 'beach'. Very good. Can you   read the whole thing?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Precious nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A-Day-at-the-Shore. Amazed the words that escaped were from her very own mout Precious' jaw drops. She whirls to Ms. Rain. Ms. Rain smiles. We ease away from the office as the two of them continue working down the page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious enters the apartment. Mary sits on the couch watching "THE COSBYS."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring your fat ass in here! Precious suddenly looks exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you sneak your ass off to this morning? Precious doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear me talking to you! Where you sneak your ass off to this morning?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: School! I was at school!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lying whore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You is! The welfare done called here, saying they is removing you from my budget 'cause you not in regular attendance in school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama, I tole you I got kicked out. I been home mostly every day for two weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't say nothin' `bout no damn school today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama, I tole you dis morning I was goin'to school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a loss but still angered, Mary turns back to the television slowly. Precious starts for her room until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain' had no breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious stops, sighs, heads to the sink and starts washi her hands. Mary talks to Precious while watching television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Need to forget school. Need to git your ass on down to welfare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious dries her hands and reaches for a pan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get stipend for school and then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fool fuck a stipend. What's that? I said take your ass down to welfare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious stops everything with the pan in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No stupid. Got to be there at 7 in the A.M. if you gonna talk to anybody...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious shakes her head, huffs and turns on the stove. M then presses the mute button on the remote and whirls aro with a cold cigarette between her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Oh you too good for that? Is that what you is now, too good for welfare? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: More white folks on 'ssistance than there is niggas Miss Onassis. Other ones got trust fund welfares from 'sploitin po dumb asses like yo dumb ass for centuries ...Man on TV say let's end 'Firmative Action. Fine wit me. And while we at it, let's take out son-in-laws, country clubs, white motherfuckers and then call it a day. Precious turns to her mother looking surprised but pensiv Mary's eyes are still fixed on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now hurry yo ass up. I'm gon die of starvation over here. Then where you be at then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A picturesque plate of pork chops and mashed potatoes. Precious delivers it to the couch with a fork and knife.

dialogues.speaker: THE APARTMENT HAS TRANSFORMED INTO THE PRISTINE WORLD OF
dialogues.text: TV SITCOM THEY WERE WATCHING. Precious and Mary are well- dressed and done-up like TV stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you gon' have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain' hungry. I ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Mama I ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit your ass down. Precious sighs and joins Mary on the couch. Mary hands Precious the plate and silverware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jus make mine after you done. This gon' get cold if it sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I thought you said you was hongry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what I say don't say what I say. Now eat bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious starts eating slowly. Mary lights her cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Best feed like a pig and not a cow so's you can git yo ass back to the stove. If I croak off starvation, where in the world you be at then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious eats reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pots and pans sit drying on the counter. Precious wipes her hands on a dishcloth. The room is quiet and empty now. Precious stares blankly out of the window. ...She goes to the television, presses the remote and sit down. "THE COSBYS" is still on. Tired and full, she turns TV off. She watches Mary's face snoring rhythmically but extremely unpleasant noises. Finally, she backs away and to her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious falls back across her bed with her arms spread. She stares up at the crack in her ceiling... A hand darts into frame, touches Precious' side and then quickly withdraws. Precious ignores it. The hand returns another jab. Precious restrains a grin. Finally the hand tickles her fiercely.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She giggles uncontrollably. The hand belongs to Tom Cruis He wears a leather jacket with a cherry red motorcycle he tucked under one arm. The helmet has a golden bow stuck o its crown. ...Precious chases him out of frame for some revenge tick as they both laugh quietly. ...The helmet falls to the floor with a bounce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Claireece, would you like to talk about your home life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious sits on a small couch in a modest office contain 2 bookshelves, several plaques and 2 file cabinets. MS. WEISS -40's, CAUCASIAN, CONSERVATIVELY DRESSED sits across from Precious with a clipboard on her lap and glas low on her nose. A strap hangs down from the glasses and snakes around the back of her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever comes to mind when you think about your home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seem like inquiring white bitches always want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I had a TV in my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... My muver is a like a whale person for the couch. She says I eat alla time, but then she always makin' me eat... and then call me a fat mess.... She says apartment is little because of me.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She only leaves the house to play the number. Sometimes I feel I could just sit there wif her everyday wif the shades drawed, watch TV, eat, watch TV, eat. Can we talk about something else now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I want to learn more about your father anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know much more than you do Miz White...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He say he the original man like Farrakhan be saying but little do he know about it. He give me this baby comin and my other one before. Thas all I know. Don't see him. Don't need to I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) What did you say your father gave you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catching herself) ...Nuffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you did Claireece. You said your father gave you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I didn't neitha. If you heard that, then you heard sumthin' else cause I ain' said nuffin like it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Weiss' wariness looks unmoved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now whas next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...How about your first child? You haven't spoken much about her...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Precious turns to Ms. Weiss. A DOORBELL RINGS ...

dialogues.speaker: TOOSIE, A WOMAN IN HER LATE 50'S RADIATING A TOUGHNESS OF
dialogues.text: GENERATIONS, enters the apartment in a business-like mann

dialogues.speaker: MONGO, A SMALL, DISTRACTED AND OBVIOUSLY HANDICAPPED CHIL
dialogues.text: Toosie has a bag of groceries in her other arm. Precious watches TV beside her mother. Both appear as if they've just woken up. Mary attempts to put on her wig an make up. Toosie gives Mongo to Mary, whose eyes never leave the television, and then hands the groceries to Precious, who takes them directly to the kitchen as Toosie leaves witho word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mongo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mongo? Thas short for Mongoloid. She got Down Sinder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean she has Down Syndrome?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alla dat. The child seems only mildly aware of what is going on. The DOORBELL rings again. Precious opens the door. A HISP WOMAN IN HER THIRTIES with an attache case enters. As the woman steps inside, we see that Mary has finished tidying herself. Mary and the woman exchange small talk while Precious listens. Mary has never seemed so congenial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My grandmuver Toosie, brangs Little Mongo over on days social worker come so it look like Mongo live wif us. Then my mama get the check 'n food stamps for me 'n Little Mongo. But it's my baby. Little Mongo is money for me, not her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious continues speaking to Ms. Weiss from the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Sometimes I see vampires too. They come for me sometimes and they say that I am one of them. They say, "Precious, you belong wif us."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you respond to them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say, "Check wif my muver." After that, they just look at me and go down through the floor. The family downstairs is vampires so that's where they should go. Ms. Weiss looks up from her clipboard and over her glasse Precious reflects a moment and then looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to the doctor now too. It's nice. Miz Rain, she fall out when she finded out that I ain' been to no doctor. Whole class scream 'preenatal' at me. They don't know I had my first baby on the kitchen floor wif my muver kicking me upside my head. I mean, who would believe? Precious snickers reminiscently a moment and then turns t Ms. Weiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Them the kind of thangs you mean when you say talk about whatever come into my mind? Ms. Weiss looks up and nods through a perplexed daze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious rides lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't know why I said all them thangs. I know I wasn't s'posed to. Just tired.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tired of lying I guess. Hope mama don't find none of it out. She kill me for real cause that be tha end of them welfare checks.

dialogues.speaker: EXT STREET
dialogues.text: The girls burst into frame followed by Ms. Rain and Cornr and then bound up a large number of steps leading into TH METROPOLITAN MUSEUM OF ART.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Led by a spirited guide and trailed by Ms. Rain and Cornr the girls scrutinize colossal tombs, various artifacts, hieroglyphics and photographs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miz Rain brang us out to see some real old stuff. Thangs and stuff before TV's was made, before Mr. Abraham Lincoln, before Miz Harriet Tubman -maybe some stuff before Miz Weiss even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious and Rita fearfully enter the Tomb of Perneb. 2 s in, Rita grabs Precious hand tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before we turn tha corner in a mummy tomb, Rita grab hold of my hand. No one in my life ever do that. Ever. (beat) How Rita do it wiffout a thought?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita and Jermaine study a sphinx.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guide lady smart. Say dis the first civilization of the Earf. Black folks, first!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jo Ann poses like an Egyptian hieroglyphic. Consuelo exam her nail polish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain writes briskly across the blackboard. As she makes her way across the frame, a barrage of lette and numbers peel off the board, fly across the room, conv and enter Precious' forehead.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Just before the letters and numbers reach Precious, lifel holographic images flank them. They are SPINNING PLANETS,

dialogues.speaker: BULBS AND THE INVERTED WORDS "JANIE", "SULA" AND "CELIE"
dialogues.text: A few letters, numbers and images try to reach Jo Ann but most just bounce off of her and fall away. Consuelo bats few mathematical symbols off as if they were flies. Finally we land on Precious as she confidently stabs her into the air to answer a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious rides on one of the side seats towards the back while wearing her red scarf. The New Yorkers surrounding her are all men of various backgrounds. All wear the exact same suits and raincoats. Precious looks up to find two of the businessmen staring at her. We pan from them and around the bus to find all of the ot passengers studying Precious in silence as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked'd that museum so much I went back by myself... Peoples ...They only look when my belly big. They minds all made. But do they know? No. They do not know that I am a girl for flowers and thin straw legs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If other peoples could see that the way I do, they would see that I am a real person inside. Our long circular pan finally lands on Precious' seat but sitting there now is the pretty blond white girl from Precious' bedroom mirror wearing Precious' clothes. The bus grinds to a stop. A man smiles at Precious and steps off the bus. The original Precious takes the abandoned newspaper from empty seat and tries to read it.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Precious stops to watch two "society" ladies in hats and gloves push antique buggy style baby carriages along the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miz Rain say the longest journey begin wif a single step. I wonder what step they journeys begin on. Mama always talk about how there be all different types of welfare. I want filfy rich white folks welfare. Mama crazy but Mama not stupid. Precious continues observing pensively as the ladies pass bearded and bedraggled elderly white man laying on the st in tattered clothes. As Precious studies him, her expression changes ever so slightly. Enormous handwritten letters forming "NOT STUPID" overtak her face as we DISSOLVE TO the PAGE upon which she wrote

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious writes in her notebook. All of the other girls d the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am happy to be writing. I am happy to be in school. I am happy to know my baby coming soon. Don't see the sense in pretending I am not pregnant anymore. I am also thinking about lil Mongo a lot. Miz Rain say we gonna write everyday, that mean home too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she gonna write back everyday. Thas great. Precious looks up to find Jo Ann tapping her pencil, look around annoyed and literally at a loss for words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama say this new school ain' shit tho. Say you can't learn nuffin' writing in no book. Gotta git on that computer you want to make some money. But Mama wrong about that.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: I is learning. Gonna read to dis baby too and hang colors on its walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We close in on Precious writing as we hear her whisper th following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Baby, Muver love you. Muver not dumb. Listen:

dialogues.speaker: PRECIOUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in a whisper)                 Thas the alphabet. Twenty- ABCDEFGHIJKLPMN                   letters in all. Them le O P Q R S T U V W X Y Z.          make up words. Them wor everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious looks up from her page gazing in an otherworldly One by one, the other girls stop what they're doing and s at Precious curiously. Their eyes turn downward in unison. CLOSE ON Precious' legs. A gush of water pours down between them as if it were a t wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The wheels of a speeding gurney waggle to remain strai ...Fluorescent lights stream by overhead. ...Name tags dangle from the chests of attendants pushing gurney. One we see belongs to a handsome African American Male nu JOHN MCFADDEN. He is constantly looking down with a reassuring smile. ...Covered in sweat, Precious screams without our hearing sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Two rain drops dance atop a puddle outside . ...Water drips from a tree limb .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name Abdul Jamal Louis Jones. He healthy. His muver love him. John, the nurse who helped gurney Precious in, again star down warmly at her. This time with Abdul in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious sleeps peacefully. It is still raining outside. Rain crochets in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are close on Precious. Her eyes focus intently and occasionally dart up and down. Nurse John is doing the same thing. His hands lay on top of Precious' with their palms touchi We glimpse both of their searching eyes again. Suddenly, Precious whips her hands over and SLAPS the bac John's before he can pull them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That hurt girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get to X-Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gon have to if you don't practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: John exits. The girls from class ogle him from another part of the ro as he leaves and then nudge and bicker with each other fo pole position to hold Abdul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Miz Rain, All the years I sit in class I never learn, but now I got baby again by my fahver. Behind the girls, Precious sits up in bed writing in her journal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I had a boyfriend like other girls and then I'd feel right that I have to quit school. I love my baby but want school too. Precious closes her book. Jo Ann backs away from the othe takes the notebook and then leaves. Rhonda returns Abdul to Precious. The remaining girls emb Precious one at a time and then file out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the girls stream into the classroom, Jo Ann sets Preci notebook on Ms. Rain's desk. Ms. Rain opens it immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain writes at her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Precious, I am glad you love your baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think a beautiful young girl like you should have a chance to get an education. I think your first responsibility has to be to yourself. You should not drop out of school ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious reads from her journal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back to class. We miss you. Love, Ms Rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious immediately writes back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Miz Rain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain sits on the corner of bed reading Precious' jour

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Social worker ask me if I want to give Little Mongo and Abdul up for adoption. I could kill her. She never help before. Now she want to take my kids away? If she take Abdul, I won't have nothing nomore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jo Ann bounds into the room with the journal in her hand, swipes an apple from Precious' tray and takes a bite. Precious snatches the journal and opens it quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Precious, It seems the opposite to me. If you keep Abdul you might have nothing. You are learning to read and write, that is everything. Come back to school when you get out of the hospital. You're only seventeen. Your whole life is in front of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOOSIE paces Precious' hospital room briskly while holdin Abdul and lecturing Precious fiercely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Miz Rain, Grandmuver come visit and say only a dog will drop a baby and walk off. Say later not even a dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious' grandmother continues her sermon. Precious sigh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Precious, You are not a dog. You are a wonderful young woman who is trying to make something of her life. I have some questions for you. 1. Where was your grandmother when your father was abusing you? 2. Where is Little Mongo now? 3. What is going to be the best thing for you in this situation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain sits at her desk reading with her pen ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Miz Rain, Lot of questions you ask. No muver, no grandmuver and father rape me years. Little Mongo wif my grandmuver. Best for me to stop breaving sometimes I think. I want to be a good mother too tho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain writes immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Dear Precious, Being a good mother might mean letting your baby be raised by someone who is better able than you to meet the child's needs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious writes while breast-feeding Abdul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Miz Rain, I is best able to meet my child's need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The page turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The page falls. The students are all at their desks readi Ms. Rain writes the following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Precious, When you are raising a small infant you need help. Who is going to help you? How will you support yourself? How will you keep learning to read and write?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We drift towards Mary, at one with the couch, watching television. One hand holds a cigarette while the other mi an enormous bag of potato chips elbow-deep. Her greasy mouth remains occupied with either a cigarette potato chip or both at all times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The welfare help Mama, it help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Precious Miss, When you get home from the hospital, look and see how much welfare has helped your mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse John and Precious sit quietly. Nurse John hands her envelope. Precious opens the envelope to find a beautiful card. It reads, "God Bless you." There is a $20 bill insi She looks up at him, teary eyed and grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious, now wearing her jacket, packs up her things, ta Abdul and heads out of a spotless room with her child in hand and two bags in the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious rides holding Abdul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could go further than your mother. You could get your G.E.D. and go to college. You could do anything Precious but you have to believe it. Love, Blu Rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious heads into the main entrance holding Abdul and h bags as snowflakes start to fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby plays alone with her broken Barbie doll. Precious pa her without a word. Ruby springs to her feet to trail her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Precious. You back? That your new baby? What it's name? Can I hold it? ..Precious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby can only watch as Precious disappears into the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Signs on the elevators read "OUT OF ORDER".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious climbs the stairs growing short of breath holdin Abdul, her bags and her coat folded over one arm. Once on the landing, she searches for her keys while tryi to balance Abdul and everything else. After turning several locks, she pushes into the apartmen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...looks up and ducks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch!!! CRASH!!! A flying vase barely misses Precious and Abdul a then shatters against the wall. Abdul WAILS.

dialogues.speaker: MAMA
dialogues.text: SMASH! A plant comes next. Precious barely dodges that one too and she drops everyth but Abdul.

dialogues.speaker: SLUT
dialogues.text: Mary charges into frame to ram Precious and Abdul like a bull. Precious sidesteps the charge as Mary leaves a huge indentation in the wall knocking over a side table and a potted plant in the process. She grabs her shoulder in pa Precious backs away around the living room to flee. Mary hurls what's left of the plant at Precious from down the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Precious turns her back to shield Abdul. The pot strikes in the back. ABDUL SCREAMS louder. Dirt covers Precious.

dialogues.speaker: STOP IT MAMA
dialogues.text: As Mary gets to her feet ...

dialogues.speaker: STUPID
dialogues.text: Tears well in Precious' eyes.

dialogues.speaker: NOT STUPID
dialogues.text: Mary GROWLS and charges Precious again. Precious turns the TV over between them. Electrical spark fly as it hits the floor. There is a banging at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary, leave that chile alone. Stop beating that girl Mary. Mary trips and crashes down on top of the overturned television. Precious dashes out of the apartment with only Abdul as M struggles to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious dashes out of the apartment with tears in her ey dirt on her clothes, no coat and Abdul SCREAMING IN HER A A little OLD WOMAN stands in the hallway shaking her head disgust.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Precious looks back, trips on the landing and tumbles dow flight of steps cradling and shielding Abdul all the way. THUD! A hard floor abruptly halts Precious' descent. She checks Abdul immediately. He is smiling. A DOOR OPENS followed by GRUNTS and a CRASH. Precious loo up to find the broken television tumbling down the steps towards them. At the last second, Precious manages to roll them both ou the way as the television crashes to the landing shatteri some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious bursts out of the stairwell with blood streaming down her nose and Abdul in her arms. Ruby dashes to inter them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious what happened? Ruby places herself between Precious and the door while moving. Precious however, is in a big hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious, could I see your baby now? I just wanna see. Precious shows no sign of slowing down. Ruby looks concer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious, what's wro... Precious knocks Ruby out of her way and to the floor with losing stride. Ruby lands hard and CRIES loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abdul still in her arms, Precious heads away from the building under dressed. The falling snow has thickened considerably. As she makes her way into the distance, Precious walks in the snowstorm carrying Abdul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears the sound of a choir. She approaches the Church Basement where the voices are coming from. Precious stares through the window where Choir members ar praising The Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary barrels into Precious' bedroom yelling and screaming she turns the place upside down. She rips down Precious' handprints along with her Cyndi Lauper poster. She then picks up a brush and hurls it int Precious' mirror, shattering it to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious, with Abdul in her arms, is singing along with t Choir, happier than ever. Tom Cruise joins in clapping, t stray dog that licked Precious in the beginning at his si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious sits on the steps of a hospital. Snow still fall She looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious steps out of an elevator wet from the snow and s splattered with dirt. She approaches a desk with urgency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to see Nurse John. Where Nurse John at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on break. He'll be back soon. Have a seat. Precious sits on one of a row of chairs by the wall. She tries to settle Abdul as he starts to CRY. The skinny Nurse's legs approach and stop in front of Precious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...You don't remember me do you?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Precious looks up to find A SOUR-LOOKING WOMAN glaring do at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I delivered your last one. Precious pauses as if searching for a response to satisfy this woman. Precious looks away. The nurse doesn't leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I'm sorry to see you back here. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remembered hoping that you would have learned from your mistakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know me bitch. Get lost 'fore I kick your ass. The nurse finally starts away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch? The nurse turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't make no mistake unless it was being born. DING! The elevator doors open. John steps off between Precious and the nurse. Precious starts to rise and John motions for her to stay seated. He sits beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Mama kick my ass again. I ain' giving Abdul away. And I ain' gonna stop school ...I just...ain't. John looks concerned. Precious speaks with great resolve as if forcing herself believe her words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get Little Mongo back too. (sighs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't hardly even know what she look like now. Don't matter tho. That don't matter. John looks on heavy-hearted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious   is dressed in a hospital gown and draped in a blanket.   It is still snowing. John holds an umbrella ov Precious   and a bag in one hand as he escorts her out on driveway   and into a large gray van.
