John places the bag in the van, hugs Precious, closes the door and then waves as the van pulls away. Precious turns to watch him recede into the snow through back window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse John say lots of people get out of hospital wif no place to go. His eyes look worried tho ...Wonder what next? Scared now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious rides in darkness cradling Abdul. She looks up frightened, taking in the others sitting around her. Shes hold Abdul closer. The dark swallows her whole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bare light bulbs hang from the ceiling. Precious lays on a bed breast feeding Abdul and staring u the ceiling while covered in a blanket. We sail away to find they are surrounded by scores of rudimentary beds, many of which are filled with other wom of varying ages.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A BUG LADY lies next to her with unkempt hair and sores o her skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (murmuring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Put your bags in bed with you. Put your bags in the bed with you. Put 'em in. Tuck 'em in bed with you... The skinny woman on the other side sits up and grabs hers feverishly as if there were bugs allover her. AN ENORMOUS AND FEROCIOUS-LOOKING WOMAN IN HER FORTIES st up, snatches the blanket off of Precious and Abdul and wa off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give the chile back her blanket!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. I ain' giving back shit. The woman walks away. Physically and emotionally spent, Precious sighs and then lifts her bed's top sheet, beneath which is a plastic-cov mattress. She then wraps the sheet around Abdul and herself and hun down. Precious rocks Abdul gently as her eyes wander around the cavernous armory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (humming)

dialogues.speaker: RS T U V, W X Y Z.
dialogues.text: (singing softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now   I know my ABC's, tell me what you   think of me. Precious kisses Abdul on the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miz Rain say I was moving through the vowel 'n consonant sounds faster than even Rhonda Johnson was. Maybe could've even catched up to Jermaine. Maybe ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious sleeps soundly. Something nudges her slightly. When she finally opens her eyes ... Abdul is gone! So is her bag. Precious springs up in a panic turning in every direction

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where my baby?! Where my baby at?! The Bug Lady casually points to the exit. The large ferocious woman heads for the exit with Abdul i one arm and Precious' bag in the other. She looks down at Abdul making "baby" faces and sounds. Precious dashes after her but winces in pain grabbing her pelvic area along the way. The Bug Lady follows Precious as a speed walker might. Precious snatches Abdul and promptly knees the ferocious woman hard in the gut. The ferocious woman MOANS as she falls to the ground. Precious continues kicking and stomping her without aband The bug girl observes stoically. Abdul WAILS. As she trounces the woman, Precious' eyes fill with a rag haven't yet seen. Finally, two other women pull Precious away while she sti kicks at the woman. The ferocious woman, now bloodied, falls over on her back with her eyes closed and her mouth hanging open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bright morning skyline stretches over the Hotel Theresa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain, at work a little earlier than usual this mornin looks great, and ready for another day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain enters the lobby. The window of the entry door h been smashed. She opens the door with a look of trepidati

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain steps into her classroom carrying two bags. She removes her sunglasses. The sight before her stops her in her tracks. She drops h bags immediately. It is Precious, sleeping on the floor with Abdul in her a Her hand is cut and bleeding pretty bad. Ms. Rain looks incensed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious sits rocking Abdul with a bandaged hand. Ms. Rain, still fuming, sits on the other side of the off dialing a phone number from a list on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell by Miz Rain's face that I ain' gonna be homeless no more. Only I ain' so sure where I'm gon end up tho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sternly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I'll hold. (grumbling while on hold)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safety net huh? What damn safety net?! A newborn child! A NEW BORN! In this fucking day and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thas the one time I heard Miz Rain curse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse my language Precious. Precious nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feels really sorry for her. She just a ABC teacher, not no social worker. But she all I could think of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda, Jermaine and Consuelo appear in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Precious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They start for Abdul immediately. Ms. Rain stops them just as quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning girls. Tell the others to start writing when they come in. Whichever one of you is older is in charge until I get back. And Consuelo, I know that is not you. So here is $20.00. Ms. Rain digs into her purse to find the money. She hands to Consuelo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go get something for Precious to wear. Quick! And bring me back my change. The girls nod and leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda and Jermaine head off down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old you is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same age as you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When your birthday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked you first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain still waits on hold until ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well why didn't you tell me that before!!! I'm sitting here half the-

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain slams the phone down, shakes her head, finds ano number on the wall and then dials again while speaking to Precious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before this day is up, you will have a place to live Precious. Ms. Rain suspends her frustration with a brief smile as s waits for the other end of the line to pick up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jo Ann saunters in. The other girls are writing already. Rhonda is at the head of the class displaying unusually g posture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at her watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jo Ann, you late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't the teacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am today. Miz Rain busy wif Precious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thrilled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright!!! (concerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How Precious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain hangs up the phone. She looks tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have ...something. It's an immediate opening and it's in Queens. Precious looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Queens ...What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really know Queens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me either. You should stay in Harlem...long as we can anyway.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain takes an organizer from her bag, looks for anoth number and picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have this West Indian friend whose boyfriend is a council member. (with uncertainty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see what they can do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious exits the girls bathroom carrying Abdul. She spo a new sweat suit. She pauses before entering Each One Teach One Reception A and observes Ms. Rain speaking on the phone for a moment. Suzanne, the school's administrator stands by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Precious. Precious jumps and turns around to find Cornrows passing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Miss Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still moving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. How you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I went to see that movie Barfly last night... That piece of shit was depressin...Cute kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Ms. Rain still on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the information on my desk. Can you hold one second? Ms rain places the call on hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to   Suzanne) I think   I may be onto something. (to   Precious) Come on   Precious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious and Ms. Rain walk back to her classroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain and Precious enter the classroom as the girls wr studiously. Rhonda supervises in a staid manner. Clearly is enjoying her new appointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you spell "Aquarius"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you want to spell that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A-Q-U-A-R-I-U-S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it's right. I'm one of `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder can you spell "boy" then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder can you spell "slut" then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe, but I bet Miss Lisa can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain picks up the line holding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Brenda. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain hangs up the phone, turns to Precious and exhale

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can take you. Tomorrow...at a place here in Harlem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious looks relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just need somewhere to stay tonight. (beat) You don't snore do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious sits at a small kitchen table in a modest but co and craftily-decorated apartment. Fresh flowers adorne he table. She breast feeds Abdul and drinks from a tall glass of gr juice. Ms. Rain clears the table of plates and take-out containers.

dialogues.speaker: WHITNEY HOUSTON IS PLAYING LOUD. KATHERINE, A SEXY BLACK
dialogues.text: WOMAN who it seems has just awoken, descends the stairs. She's not in a good mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, how many times did I tell you about the music? She stops in mid sentence when she sees precious. Her moo changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warmly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be Precious. Hi. Katherine bends down to admire Abdul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious, this is my wife Katherine. Precious looks confused. She spits her drink out. A lot o which lands on Abdul. She wipes Abdul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said that this is my wife Katherine. Precious' mouth is agape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling at Abdul) What's his name? He's adorable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Abdul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks just like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. (beat) Y'all really married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Precious. Very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious still looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ladies lounge around the living room. Ms. Rain and Katherine hold glasses of wine. Precious still looks as i she's trying to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Ask yourself. Just ask yourself; if Ronald McDonald were running the show and the price of hamburgers skyrocketed, wouldn't you be suspicious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just think you should finish the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's gonna read it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody if you don't write it. Precious writes everyday. You should try it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you write about Precious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Stuff in my life. Abdul.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: (beat) How come y'all don't like McDonalds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine was just drawing a comparison so that her point could be more easily understood...

dialogues.speaker: PRECIOUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Together, these homo ladies        It's called an analogy talk like TV channels I don't      example, my uncle Clay watch. I'm glad Abdul here to      used to smoke like a c listen in on 'em tho cause I       and drink like a fish know they smart.                   he got saved. An Etta James tune begins ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain and Katherine, high from the wine, spin each oth lazily in a playful dance. Precious sits watching carefully. She lifts and smells th gardenias from the table. Precious starts to pour a bottle of wine into her glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama say homos is bad peoples ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand intercepts the bottle. It is Ms. Rain's. She then pours it into her own glass and takes the bottle with her she returns to Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But homos not who rape me, homos not who let me sit up in school 16 years and learn nuffin and homos not sell crack to peoples in Harlem. I wonder what Oprah have to say about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain looks over to Precious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay Precious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y' all watch Oprah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain gives her a loving smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miz Rain the one who put the chalk in my hand, make me queen of ABC's.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Precious smiles back with gratitude and great affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain and Katherine continue dancing in the window as Precious observes. The evening cityscape sparkles around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Streamers hang from the walls. Various handwritten versio of "Congratulations Precious", obviously written by the girls, stretch across the blackboard in uneven-sized lett Precious stands beside Ms. Rain holding a small trophy an check. The other girls flank them standing very straight. wear big grins.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHPWOOWF
dialogues.text: Nurse John, without his uniform, has just taken a picture everyone. The girls go straight for the cookies and punch waiting a an orange tablecloth on Ms. Rain's desk. They begin a Sou Train Line and dance around the desk as Nurse John approa Ms. Rain to converse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After I settle in halfway house, I work my hardest to memorize letter sounds, write in journal and read smaller and fatter books. Then I find out Mayor's office give me Literacy Award and check for progress. Everybody at the party, Nurse John, Cornrows and the staff stop in too, but they need to get back to they desks before too long. Whole operation can't stop just cause Miss Precious get a trophy. Even Ms. Katherine shows. John discreetly beckons Precious over to the side as she blows into a noisemaker. Both she and John dance in high spirits.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: John hands Precious a giftwrapped present. She shakes it then opens it. It is a leather bound journal with blank pages. Precious flips through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Nurse John. They exchange a familiar, moderately complicated handshak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome. What are you gonna do with your award money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe the chicken place for a bucket that I swiped last year. Thas first. After that, get some thangs for Abdul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Blu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miz Rain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Precious holds up two intertwined fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like dis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well she has, has she uh...got a man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I was hoping you could put in the good word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The good word...wif Ms. Rain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's what I'm trying to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't her type. John looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious leads John down the hall by the hand. She stops in front of Cornrows' desk as Cornrows converse the phone while picking her nails. The previously illegible sign on her desk now reads "EACH TEACH ONE".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone noticing Precious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on girl. Cornrows lowers the phone and waits for Precious to speak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Lisa this Nurse John. Nurse John this Miss Lisa. Cornrows looks up at John. Precious heads back to the party. Nurse John and Cornrows watch her curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all work it out. Nurse John and Cornrows turn to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi ...How are you? Cornrows looks him up and down then hangs up the phone without looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get off at 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is empty except for Ms. Rain standing on a chair taking streamers down. Precious appears in the doorway and studies Ms. Rain a mo as if seeing her for the first time. Ms. Rain steps down from her chair looking tired. Precious enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miz Rain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious, I thought you went home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. I forgot to say thank you for my party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome. It was my pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious just watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there something else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was thinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talk to us girls in the class when we be working out problems and thangs and stuff, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain speaks to Precious while picking up around the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm hm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, who do you talk to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caught off guard, Ms. Rain looks at Precious curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) Or you probably don't have no problems so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody has those Precious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain, some folks just got it made in the shade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It only looks that way. Yes, I talk to people all the time for support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay...I didn't have nobody to really speak wif for a long time. I know how that be sometimes so thas why I asked cause almost evrybody need a little help once in a ... Ms. Rain abruptly stops what she's doing. Precious looks alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What on earth are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well ...only that -well, evrybody need a little help once in a ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I jus ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought that if you might need some ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trembling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've helped me already.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Precious looks both confused and relieved. Ms. Rain sits while motioning for Precious to do the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting) Me? I never...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious stops as Ms. Rain looks away as if gathering her thoughts. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night I had a conversation with my mother, and that never happens cause our relationship is.... complicated. We don't speak, and when we do, it always ends in a fight about my filthy misguided existence. Most times I feel terrible for days afterwards wondering whether all the hateful things she said are true. Those days I just feel like...like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nuffin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yeah. I didn't feel so bad this time though. (beat) Cause this time I thought about how strong you've had to be and then I decided that I had nothing to be ashamed of and that my mother was wrong about me, my dad and 5 or 6 hundred other things. You ask if you can help me? Baby, you already have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...For real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the for real, hope to die if I'm lying truth. Now shouldn't you be out the door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I jus help you finish up first. I got some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. Ms. Rain motions to the other end of a long folding table Precious takes hold of it and they carry it across the ro together. As we watch from a distance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some folks got a light around them that shine for other peoples. I think maybe some of them was in a long tunnel before. And in that tunnel, maybe the only light they had was one that was inside of them and then -even long after they escaped that tunnel, they still be shining for everybody else. Thas Miz Rain to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious' trophy sits on the windowsill beneath a thin a layer of dust. A stack of books sit on her bureau. Colorful letters and numbers hang on the wall. Beneath th hang postcards featuring Zora Neal Hurston, Alice Walker, Maya Angelou and Oprah Winfrey. Abdul sleeps in his crib. Precious makes her bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a book I read, a lady escaped to a 1/2 way house. And the lady, she asked the people there just what a 1/2 way house was. They tole her, you is 1/2 way between the life you had and the life you want to have ...Thas nice. That also mean I can't stay here forever and that there is still a ways to go. It be something to get apartment of my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A larger Abdul steps towards us with Precious behind him wearing a cotton dress that looks vaguely like one Ms. Ra might wear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abdul nine months old and walking! Smart too. I been reading to him since the day he was born almost. Barely talkin' and he countin' .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious plays with Abdul in the shallow end of the commu swimming pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama, Daddy, I.S. III and 444 Lenox Avenue already seem like a past life or some old bad dream. I wish I could have started out from here but still wif Abdul and poor Mongo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious looks out of her open window with a glass of wat in her hand. KNOCK KNOCK KNOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in... Precious closes her window. The door to her room opens. CHELSEA, A 30-S0METHING SOCIA WORKER steps in looking slightly uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious ...you have a visitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thas Rhonda. She always early. Precious rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should've said 4 'cause then that way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not Rhonda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious descends a staircase to a long corridor clearly in thought every step of the way. She stops momentarily to straighten her clothes. When she finally reaches a day room at the other end of t hall, she looks through its window for a moment. Mary sits inside crushing and dwarfing the couch upon whi she waits. She looks frail. Her wig is half combed. She's nervous. Her sweaty hands crumple her cigarette package. Precious covers her nose a moment, lowers her hand, readi herself and then steps into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once inside the room, and for the first time, Precious' s face looks like stone. Mary looks up with a brief but quickly fading smile that pathetic, apologetic and grim. Precious waits. The air is thick without a single word between them. Finally, Mary looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daddy dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious looks surprised for a moment but still composed. Mary waits for a response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Is that all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (beat) Carl ...Carl had that AIDS virus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A previously unseen woman sitting across the room looks u from behind a newspaper. Precious stays stone-faced until she finally GASPS as the aftershock of the revelation hits her squarely. The man across the room collects his hat and coat and lea

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF PRECIOUS, PRECIOUS FOLLOWING ABDUL TAKING EARLY ST
dialogues.text: We return to the dayroom as Precious opens her eyes and l them to Mary slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AIDS virus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We never did, you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't know Mama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We never did what you got to do to get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never been wif you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...but not like faggots, in the ass and all, so I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious is speechless. It looks as if some of her anger suddenly been displaced with pity.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Precious sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better go to the doctor Ma. Mary looks up delicately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You welcome back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm home here. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better go see 'bout Abdul and do homework. Mary doesn't move as Precious leaves. Mary sits staring at the floor at the far side of the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious enters, takes Abdul from his crib, holds him clo and sits on her bed. Moments later, a TAPPING on the window draws her attentio Precious rises to find Tom Cruise hurling pebbles up at h window in a leather jacket. A MOTORCYCLE sits a few feet away from him. He beckons her. She stares down at him with solemn eyes. Tom finally mounts his bike and vanishes into thin air wh revving its engine. Mary then crosses the frame where he was. Precious turns to Abdul and kisses him on the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious walks over the crest of a hill deep in thought w her hands in her pockets. The constant HUM of the city se lower than usual as Precious' FOOTSTEPS make the most prominent sound.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: From this distant view, it appears as if she is almost walking in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Rain stands before the blackboard with a piece of cha in her hand pointing to the word "unrelenting", which is written behind her. Consuelo is missing and TWO NEW GIRLS, AISHA, INDIAN AND GUYANA AND BUNNY, VERY THIN WITH BAD TEETH have joined th class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita, what do I mean when the author describes her protagonist's circumstances as "unrelenting"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know Miz Rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Rita, think about the question before you just give up like that... Ms. Rain's voice trails off as we find Precious lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious waits in a small gray office. A FEMALE COUNSELOR WITH SYMPATHETIC EYES carrying a file across from her. Her eyes say everything. The counselor places a hand on top of Precious'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the girls write in their journals except for Precious who again looks preoccupied. Ms. Rain watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious? Precious doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire class looks up at Precious. Ms. Rain waits for a response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious, bring your journal to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious waits a moment and then shakes her head without looking up. Ms. Rain goes to her desk and picks up the journal withou resistance. The words "Why me?" sit alone on the page with lines cros through them. Ms. Rain returns the journal to Precious' d still opened to the same page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious, would you come to my office for a moment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious doesn't respond. The class still watches curiously. Ms. Rain, steps back, sits on the edge of her desk and fo her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Preci-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse say I am H.I.V. positive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air changes sharply. Everything stops. Precious exhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have nuffin to write today and I don't hate no one. Not even my muhver. My head is all dark inside so I don't have nuffin to write today...Maybe nuffin never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita rises, walks to Precious and embraces her. Tears wel Precious' eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Still trying to stay composed, Precious wipes her face. Ms. Rain rises, walks to Precious and rubs her back as sh looks around to the other girls who are still stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your baby okay? The class waits on pins and needles. Precious doesn't ans at first and just looks down until ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He good...Won't bress feed him no more to be safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Precious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One time in your journal you told me that you had never really told your story. (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: write. Precious' eyes well up some more. She wipes her face again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for? How?! I feel like I am drowning inside a giant river Miz Rain. Thas what... Precious stops herself abruptly as if being overwhelmed b sense of futility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think telling your story will get you over that river Precious ... Precious erupts hurling her journal sharply across the ro It bounces hard off the blackboard and stops abruptly on floor facedown.

dialogues.speaker: CHILD
dialogues.text: The class looks shocked. Precious' wet eyes are filled wi fury.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A moment later, Ms. Rain walks calmly across the room, retrieves the journal and places it back on top of Precio desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open your notebook Precious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired Miz Rain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you are but you can't stop now. You gotta fight through this. You still have to live your life and do the best you can with the hand you've been dealt. If not for yourself then for the people who love you. Precious HUFFS cynically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody love me. Thas a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People do love you Precious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't lie Miz Rain! Love?! Me?! Love rape me, beat me, call me animal, get me sick and make me feel wurfless. I had enough love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't love. There are people in this room who love you. Your child loves you too. Is that clear Precious? Now if Rita decided to just give up? Would you let her? Precious doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why not?!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Precious doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you love her...as much as she loves you. Precious looks to her side and finds Rita smiling reassuringly through her crooked teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the rest of the world can judge you, cheat you, beat you, dismiss you and abandon you all it wants but we won't let you give up and that's the only thing that matters. Some people have less than that on their side and still manage to keep going. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's up to you. Precious thinks a long moment, wipes her face and exhales She doesn't move for what seems like ages. The whole class watches her until Ms. Rain motions for th to continue working. Finally, Precious takes hold of her opens her journal, sighs deeply and starts to write again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our young ladies and Ms. Rain are seated around a picnic table eating, laughing, talking and writing in their jour all at the same time. Precious has found friends. As we watch Rhonda ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some things is hard to say and maybe not your business no way but Rhonda's brother rape her for years and when her muhver fine out, she throw Rhonda out her house. As we watch Rita smiling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita's daddy kill her muhver in front of her eyes and Rita been out on the street selling herself since she 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we watch Jermaine laughing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jermaine say mens beat her and then rape her for what she is. Muhver throw her out the house when she fine out that she different from other girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we watch Ms. Rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miz Rain still a sort of mystery, but a nice one like the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we watch the group from a distance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miz Rain right too. These girls is my family now. They visit me at hospital when I had Abdul and even take up a collection when Mama kick me out. They got love in they eyes and in they hearts for me, same as I got for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Weiss speaks from behind her desk as Precious sits on couch beside her backpack looking bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You know you can use your notebook between sessions Claireece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean you can use it specifically for trying to recover certain early memories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious nods mechanically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tired of this lady asking me questions. Miz Rain say talk anyway but Miz Weiss just a spy for the State who write reports on me undercover. Reports go in file. File say what I could get, where I could go and if I could get cut off and kicked out of Advancement House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) What are you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I doubt that Claireece. It seems like you're always thinking about something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It's sort of hot in here I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is, isn't it? As a matter of fact, I'm going to get myself something to drink. Would you like something to drink Claireece?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A soda sounds nice ...please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh c'mon, you must.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okee Dokee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Weiss collects some change, grins at Precious and the steps out of the room leaving her purse open on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in a jiffy. The moment the door closes, Precious dashes across the ro for the file cabinet behind Ms. Weiss' desk. Precious searches the drawers in the cabinet and rifles through the files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Weiss inserts several pieces of change into a vending machine and presses a button. A can of Soda CLUNKS down through the bowels of the machine.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE
dialogues.text: Pouring through the "J" files, Precious stops at Jones an then first goes for "P". She sees nothing, sucks her teet thinks a moment and then looks for "C".

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Ms. Weiss saunters back towards the office whistling soft with 2 sodas in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE
dialogues.text: Precious finally finds the file with her name on it and l up as FOOTSTEPS sound outside the door. Ms. Weiss steps in. Precious is now seated on the couch again with a corner o her file protruding from her bookbag. Ms. Weiss hands Precious her soda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know your mother's been calling here wanting to come visit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like her to come to a counseling session with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I never really thought about it before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's just one more thing to consider before I see you next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Weiss smiles at Precious. Precious smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jermaine rocks Abdul's crib with one hand while looking a the file with Precious as both girls sit cross-legged on Precious' bed. Precious reads carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'I have just finished a session with Claireece Precious Jones, an eighteen-year-old African American female. According to her teachers at Each One Teach One where she attends school she is a pen-, phen-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... 'phenomenal'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...success. Having made strides so tre-men-tremendous in the past year, she was given the mayor's award for outstanding achievement. She seems actively en...engaged in all aspects of the learning process. However, her TABE test scores are disappointingly low... ' Not to Miz Rain! Not to Miz Rain! (continuing) 'She scored 2.8 On her last test.' So what! Miz Rain-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a grip and gon' read the report and don't get all emotional about what this silly hoe got to say. Anyway, if your shit wasn't dope you wouldn't be standing up here readin' -what, what's her name (looks up on the page)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ms. Weiss. What Ms. Weiss got to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'She will need at least an 8.0 Before she can enter G.E.D. Class and begin work toward her high school e-q...equivalency.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised and impressed, Jermaine double takes on Preciou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. (beat) 'Abdul is the client's second-born child. He's from all outwhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'outward'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Appearances, a healthy and welladjusted toddler. Precious attends to his needs a-s-s-i-d-u-o-s-l-y...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious and Jermaine look at each other. Both are at a loss... PRECIOUS & JERMAINE Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... 'and with great affection and ee... '

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'eagerly'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... 'seeks any and all information on child rearing. The time and resources it would require for this young woman to get a G.E.D. or into college would be considerable'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious stops reading abruptly and hands the file to Jermaine. Jermaine looks at Precious oddly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish reading this ...I know what's coming. Jermaine pauses and then continues reading the file as Precious rises and paces the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Although she is in school now, it is not a job readiness program. Nonetheless, Claireece is capable of going to work. In January, her son will be two years old. In keeping with the new initiative on welfare reform, I feel Claireece would benefit from any of the various workfare programs in existence. Despite her obvious intellectual limitations she is quite capable of working as a home attendant.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be no motherfucking home attendant! I wanna be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hush! 'My rapp-o-r-t with Precious is minimal. Although I am not sure with whom, she evidently has access to counseling services provided by Each One Teach One. She has a history of sexual abuse and is H.I.V. positive.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She say she not put that in my file! Bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the bitch's job, to get the mofuckin' goods on you! (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'The client seems to view the social services, AFDC, as taking care of her forever.' Jermaine sets the file down and looks up at Precious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That file do show one thing -that

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: this hoe don't know nuffin wurf knowing about Claireece Precious Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting my G.E.D., a job, and a place for me and Abdul, then I go to college. I don't want to 'home attend' nobody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better put this shit back before you get in trouble. We talk about it with Ms. Rain in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious hurries into a room carrying Abdul. The sign on door says "DAYCARE". Precious dashes out of the room alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't be coming back late for his bad ass neither.

dialogues.speaker: EXT STREET
dialogues.text: Precious marches to school with her bookbag and red scarf She clearly has a lot on her mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miz Weiss just part of the gang but definitely not cool. And social worker look at me like I am ugly freak who did something to make my own life like it is. I guess I am trying to figure out just what has happened to me while Miz Weiss just hell bent on making me go wipe old people's asses. Precious crosses the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got to sort dis out quick tho 'fore Abdul's next birthday -coming up fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole class writes until Ms. Rain looks at her watch and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time is up. Does anyone want to share?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only hand up belongs to Precious'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Precious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really want to read all I wrote, I jus' wanna kinda say what it is I'm writing about and how it came about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, to make a long story short, the counselor at Advancement House quizzing me about Mama and Daddy etc., etc. But it's really about workfare. She want to send me out as home attendant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause I stole my file from Advancement House and read it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class GASPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time get mine's too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this 'What you wanna be?' And 'You can talk to me.' They ain' no motherfucking therapists on our side, they just flunkies for the 'fare. I wanna work, but not for no motherfucking welfare check in Central Park -displacing brothers and sisters who really got jobs cleaning up 'cause I'm there working for free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jermaine speaks while slouched in her chair with her feet crossed and arms folded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what kinda shit is it for someone like Precious to have quit school before she get her G.E.D. to work at some live-in job for some old-ass crackers. She'll never make a rise she get stuck in some shit like that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit up straight Jermaine and watch your language. Both of you. Please. Jermaine reluctantly sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I see your points, but is stealing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miz Rain, If I didn't steal that file I wouldn't know what I was facing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You read the whole thing by yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...basically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda home attend. Say old bitch would ring a bell when she want Rhonda in the night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda used to have to go all the way out to Brighton Beach where she work for them people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people had her there all day and night - 'on call' they call it. But you only get pay for 8 hours so that's 8 X $6.37 (referring to her notebook)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: = $50.96 a day, but then you is not really getting that much cause you is working more than eight hours a day. You is working 24 hours a day and 50.96 divided by 24 is...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: (referring to her notebook)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: $2.12 by my count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda say old bitch would ring a bell - a actual bell -when she want Rhonda in the night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home attendants usually work six days a week. I would only see Abdul on Sundays? When would I go to school? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I gonna hafta go be home attendant like Rhonda was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! So stop worrying about it. We'll cross that bridge when we get to it. Trust me -no, trust yourself. My concern now is that if this Ms. Weiss is someone you're working with and can't trust, she's out! We gotta find somebody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I just write in my notebook till I get wif some kinda therapist I can trust. Actually that always help me more than talking to her. Plus, I'm going to start going to meetings wif Rita for insect survivors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it ain't what you been saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the big deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One's where your family molest you, the other is like a roach or bugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious, have you ever had your hearing tested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I never really had nothing tested...nothing like that. Glasses is what I really want so my eyes don't hurt when I be reading at night. The sound of a RUMBLING BUS ENGINE accelerating leads us to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita looks out the window of a moving 102 bus and then st across the aisle and sits beside Precious who stares out window pensively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita and me on our way. I look at subway map sometimes and wonder where I be if I go to the end of the line. Jermaine say there be a white boy wif a baseball bat when you get off. Rita say it's not true, or if it be true, it's only part true. The bus comes to a stop and the girls dash out the back d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious and Rita climb up out of the subway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious and Rita walk with Precious looking around as Ri hums quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a simple meeting room, women of all different ages, co and strata sit in a large circle.

dialogues.speaker: IRENE, A GORGEOUS SLENDER BLOND WITH LUSTROUS HAIR AND
dialogues.text: SPARKLING EYES stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello and welcome to our Tuesday night beginner's meeting...My name is Irene. I am an incest survivor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious looks utterly amazed. Her jaw drops. From here, women's voices are so faint that they are barely audible we hear Precious' thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: PRECIOUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This girl look like a movie       It started when I was a star and she in here too?!        or 5 years old with him All kinda women in here.          fondling me. By the tim Princess girls, big girls,        was 12, he was having old women, young women, white     intercourse with me 3 o women, lotta white women.         Times a week... A montage of other women standing and speaking follows. A the women talk, Precious' face fills with the wonder of seeing the world through the window of a spacecraft heade for re-entry. CANDACE, SIXTIES, WHITE speaks next.

dialogues.speaker: PRECIOUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What am I hearing?! What in       ....I didn't remember w h the world?! One hour and a        father did to me for so alf women talk. How can this     years until after he die happen to so many people? CAITLIN, 20's, WHITE speaks.

dialogues.speaker: PRECIOUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And these is just the ones        ...I am a proud lesbian that come out to the meeting.     it's the only thing I'm What about the rest? Do I         of. I was confined to a pass them in the street and       mental institution for do not know?                      years.... Finally, Precious stands. She looks around as if seeing from the top of a mountain. Finally she clears her throat and then ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was raped by my father and beat by my mother ever since I could remember anything at all. Raped and beat by both.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The worst part about it...the part even worse than them doin' it...was how shamed I felt during the times when my father was raping me and it felt ...good. Anyway, I see a girl and always think I know how easy or bad she have it just by lookin'. Now I wonder if everybody go through sumthin' -sumthin' that leave a shadow in they life. (exhales)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never said alla that before... Precious looks around the room to find herself surrounded understanding eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, thas all I'd like to say for today. Thank y'all for letting me share... Irene nods and Precious sits. Rita squeezes her hand. Ano woman stands up to recount her story. Precious looks aglo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is floating around me now. Like geeses from the lake. I see flying. Feel flying. Am flying. Far up...Thank you Rita for getting me here on time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group slowly emerges. A table with a nice arrangement cookies stands next to a coffee maker and soda machine. Irene chats with Candace over a cup of coffee. Precious a Rita talk with TWO OTHER YOUNG WOMEN, MIRIAM, BLACK 20's PRETTY DREADLOCKS and LISA, WHITE 20's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...How you get your hair like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you like it? I do yours one day if you want. That's what I do - fix people's hair and makeup. Miriam hands Precious a card. Precious reads the card carefully and puts it away with care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you Miriam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Precious) Do you want another hot chocolate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious smiles and shakes her head no. Rita gets up. Precious watches her go as Miriam and Lisa chat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita ask me do I want another hot chocolate. I do but I don't want to be greedy, even if her boyfriend do give her money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious looks around at all of the other girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm alive inside. A bird is my heart. Mama and Daddy didn't win. I'm winning. I'm drinking hot chocolate on the Upper West Side with girls - all kind who love me. How does a stranger meet me and love me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita returns with two cups of hot chocolate.       She gi to Precious. Precious thanks Rita with her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious, wearing her new scarf and glasses, sits in the waiting room holding a book in her hands. Abdul plays amo the little children in the kids area behind her. Crumpled wrapping paper lays beside her. The book's first page rea CONGRATULATIONS PRECIOUS! I'M SO PROUD OF YOU YET AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheila and Ruby walk in and sit down beside Precious. Rub has a black eye. They sit in silence for a few moments, waiting for their turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheila Hewitt, Ms. Rubenstein is                          ready for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Ruby)                                        Go on back there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there are no kids there I can                    play with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to knock your other                   eye out! Just sit there and shut                     up then! I'm going to talk to this                   lady before my shit gets cut off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheila heads up the stairs toward the offices. Precious closes her book. Its cover reads: Chrystal Stair: Selecte Works by Langston Hughes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clareece Precious Jones!   Mrs.                      Weiss is ready for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious stands up and looks down at Ruby, sulking in her chair. She leans down, gives her a big hug and tenderly fixes Ruby's hair. Precious walks off toward the stairs, but stops when she passes a mirror hanging on the wall. Within the reflectio she sees her true self for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day Miz Rain ask us to write about our ideal self...I wrote that I would be light skinned and small wif wavy swing-job hair. She heads up the stairs toward the offices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miz Rain read all that and then say I am beautiful like I am. I never believe her before but somehow, today, this moment -can't say why, I do. Just now...The inside I thought was so beautiful is a black girl too.

dialogues.speaker: R141 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Precious turns around to find that Ruby has grabbed her a She then reaches up and hugs Precious tightly. Through the embrace, Precious finds herself facing the ma mirrors on display by the old man on the folding chair. I her reflections, she sees the skinny white girl who she h frequently imagined herself as gradually transform into t real Precious one by one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We tilt down upon a stately pre-war building bathed in st wintry light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps we should begin by talking a little bit about the abuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary looks worse than ever. Her hair and clothing are disastrous. She rocks somewhat anxiously on the edge of h seat like a desperate salesman looking to close a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Buse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Ms. Johnston. Abuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no drugs in ma house! No drugs! 'Cause Precious know damn well I whoop her ass bright blue if she bring some drugs in ma...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm referring to inappropriate acts of a physical and sexual nature involving Precious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'nt you say dat? Dat?! Okay. When it first start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. According to Precious' files she has had two children by your boyfriend, the late Carl Kenwood Jones, who is also her father?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: You've been calling here saying you want to be reunited with your daughter and grandson and that you want them to come home. Well I think you'd better explain just what happened in that home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious waits nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Well, I, Precious b'long at home cause I'm a good mother. She had everything. I done tole her that. Pink 'n white baby carriage, little pink bootie socks, dresses; everything I put on her pink. Precious, she so smiling and healthy. A day don't go by I don't throw her wheeling in the air. I take her up and down 125th Street. Me 'n Carl loved Precious. I dreamed of the day we was gonna you know, git married, git house wif grass, color TV's in all the rooms. Precious, She born about the same time as Miz West son that got kilt. You remember him don't you Precious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious looks at a loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He born summertime 'bout same time as you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was born in November...far as I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah yeah thas right. My little Scorpio chile! Scorpio's crafty. I ain' sayin' they lie, jus' you cain't always trust 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious looks embarrassed beyond embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Johnston, when did the abuse happen, how often, where? And, when were you first aware of what was going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When? I don't know when it start. When I remember it? She still little. Yeah, around three maybe. I give her a bottle. I still got milk in my bresses but not from her but from Carl sucking. I give him tittie, Precious bottle. Hygiene, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (floored)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mentioned something about hygiene in connection with... Ms. Weiss can't go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bottle her, tittie him. Bottle more better for kidz. Sanitary. But I never git dried up 'cause Carl always on me. It's like that you know. Chile, man -a woman got bofe. What you gonna do? So we in bed. I put her one side of me on pillow, Carl on other side of me. Ms. Weiss looks as if she's stopped breathing. I think thas the day IT start. So he on me. Then he reach over to Precious! I say Carl what you doing! He say shut your big ass up! This good for her. I say stop Carl stop! I want him on me! I never wanted him to hurt her. I didn't want him doing anything to her. I wanted my man for myself -to sex me up, not my chile. Me God damn it! So you cain't blame all that shit happen to Precious on me. I love Carl, I loved him. He her daddy but he was my man! Mary can't help but to shoot a look of anger at Precious while Ms. Weiss pauses to regain her composure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious nods reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady from Each One Preach One say she got poems too. In fact...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough Mama. That's ... enough. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I didn't realize what you was until this day -even after all those thangs you did. Maybe I didn't know no better or maybe I just didn't want to but I finally see you crystal clear for the first time. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgive you too. Mary smiles warmly and nods confidently to Ms. Weiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but I'll never see you again. Not even if you dead. Mary's expression drops. Precious turns to Ms. Weiss as M starts to spring up from her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking at her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay down Mama. Mary sits obediently. Precious turns to Ms. Weiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgive you too. I can tell right now that you ain't qualified for dis kind of mess. Precious thinks a moment and grins a grin that seems much older.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Precious? I was thinking we might...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took the TABE test again. This time it's 7.8. Last time it was 2.8.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: According to the test, I'm reading around 7th or 8th grade level now. High school level next. College after that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Why congratulations Precious. That's ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious stands abruptly, startling both women. She takes step towards her mother. Mary winces. Ms. Weiss looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious, perhaps it's best if you remain seat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious leans and kisses Mary tenderly on the cheek, tur and gently touches Ms. Weiss' shoulder. Precious takes a good look at them both, smiles and leave the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Weiss calls after her. Precious keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious doesn't stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women run to the window. They see Precious burst out onto the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious walks down the crowded street carrying Mongo and Andre. She is happy and filled with hope. Tom Cruise is t chatting up another young girl... she pays him no mind.

dialogues.speaker: DEDICATION
dialogues.text: ...for precious girls everywhere.
